result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denise Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant had transportation issues coming to Court today.  Defense advised that the TWO (2) children in question will be beginning school TOMORROW (11-01-2017).  COURT CONTINUED THE STAYED WARRANT.  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant is at the hospital with a family member.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.
(1).  (EMAIL).  Correspondence from DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has COMPLETED Community conferencing.  Defense advised that Defendant DID enroll the child(ren) in summer school, however Defendant lost housing in the interim.  Defense advised that Defendant will be able to secure a residence by AUGUST, 1 2017.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke for Francisco Araiza.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JUDY B. appeared on behalf of the OSPD.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense advised that Defendant does have an appointment scheduled to establish an IEP.  JUDY B advised that she will assist the Defendant in setting up summer School.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
(2).  Attendance records.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin for Francisco Araiza.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  case was Staffed in Chambers.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court COMMENDED Defendant for her compliance with the Agreement as of this hearing.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised that the defendant's children are not currently enrolled in school.  In-chambers discussion held.  Defendant advised that the case will be referred to Children's Court if the defendant fails to enroll children in school.  Case remains calendared in branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has followed through with the Community Conference.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court advised Defense to explore JUDY B from the OSPD as a facilitator.  Defendant will report to ERIN K of the DA's Office following this hearing.  COURT RESTARTED THE DPA AS OF THIS DATE (01-10-2017).  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY/NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction DEFERRED by the Court.  
Deferred Prosecution Agreement signed, reviewed and filed by the Court.  Case is adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 33.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Both parties are ready to proceed. Case passed. Case recalled. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of today's proceedings. State does not object. Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Denise Reed in court.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Defense counsel is unavailable for today's proceedings. Jury trial remains calendared for 10/10/2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 47.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case remains calendared in Branch 47 Final pre-trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Denise Reed in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Defendant Denise Reed in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Denise Reed not in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/1/15 @ 1:30pm
